intro: Trixis ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Its leaves are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Trixis ehrenbergii produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
